meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Alright, folks! It's your favorite seasonal grok video game reviewer here to dish out the lowdown on West of Loathing. Now, I know what you're thinking: "Grok" is a weird word. And you're right! But hey, it's my thing, and I'm sticking to it.

So, let's get down to business. West of Loathing is a game that had me laughing so hard, I almost spilled my coffee (and I'm not even a morning person!). This absurd RPG has got humor pouring out of every pixel, and I'm here for it!

The critics seem to agree, too. GameCritics gave it a perfect 100, saying it's "fantastic on every level." Digital Chumps praised its balance of role-playing and absurdity, calling it a "primary attraction." Even Nintendo Insider, known for their tough love, called it a "must-own" game.

Now, I'm not gonna lie: the combat system can be a bit lacking. But honestly, who needs intense battles when you've got ridiculous storylines and stick figures that are just... wow? It's like someone poured a bag of silly on my head and said, "Have fun with this!"

GamingTrend noted that the world is "dynamic" and full of humor, which I'd agree with. And let's be real, who doesn't love a good dose of absurdity in their gaming experience? FNintendo summed it up nicely: West of Loathing is a game for those who enjoy humor, text-based storytelling, and an absurd plot.

Cubed3 had a similar take, saying the game proves to be "truly entertaining" despite its simple aesthetic. And NintendoWorldReport nailed it with their review: this game is all about making you happy while you play it, and that's exactly what happened for me!

In short, West of Loathing is a wild ride full of humor and charm. If you're looking for something to put a smile on your face, look no further!
